messageBody:
epahelper wrote:

> hello,
>
> just wondering if there's a way to use junit to test whether a Logger
> is spitting out the expected output to console.
>

Design the Logger to be composed of an output stream of some sort, then
define a mock output stream that captures the output. You can then assert
that the mock output stream captured the expected output.

public MockWriter implements Writer {
private String _output;

public void write(String s) {
_output = s;
}

public String getWhatWasWritten() {
return _output;
}

...
}

public class Logger {

private Writer _writer;

public Logger(Writer writer) {
_writer = writer;
}

public void log(String message) {
_writer.write(message);
}

public void testWriter() {

MockWriter writer = new MockWriter();
Logger logger = new Logger(writer);

logger.log("test");

assertEquals("test", writer.getWhatWasWritten());
}
